title: Shri Vitthal-Rukmini Temple
subtitle: Dehu, Pune
overview: The Shri Vitthal-Rukmini Temple in Dehu is one of the most sacred pilgrimage centers in Maharashtra. It is closely associated with the revered saint Sant Tukaram Maharaj, who was a key figure in the Bhakti movement. Dehu is considered his birthplace and the starting point of the famous Tukaram Palkhi Yatra to Pandharpur.
This temple is dedicated to Lord Vitthal and Goddess Rukmini, forms of Lord Vishnu and Goddess Lakshmi, and stands as a symbol of devotion and equality.

highlights.title: Sant Tukaram Legacy
highlights.description: Dehu is the birthplace of Sant Tukaram Maharaj, whose abhangas (devotional hymns) continue to inspire devotees even today.

highlights.title: Tukaram Palkhi Yatra
highlights.description: Each year, thousands of devotees participate in the Palkhi procession from Dehu to Pandharpur, carrying the palkhi (palanquin) of Tukaram Maharaj.

geography.intro: Dehu is located on the banks of the Indrayani River, around 30 km from Pune. The serene riverside setting and the constant chanting of abhangas create a deeply spiritual environment.

climate.description: Dehu enjoys a moderate climate with warm summers, mild winters, and refreshing monsoons that enhance its lush greenery.

seasons.text: Best visited from November to February.
Monsoon adds charm to the riverside surroundings.

geography.conclusion: Dehu’s spiritual energy and continuous recitation of Tukaram’s abhangas make it a powerful place of devotion and introspection.

activities.title: Temple Darshan
activities.description: Offer prayers at the ancient temple dedicated to Lord Vitthal and Goddess Rukmini.
info: Open daily from 5 AM to 10 PM.
Aarti timings are at sunrise and sunset.

activities.title: Abhanga Recitations
activities.description: Listen to soulful abhangas of Sant Tukaram sung daily by local devotees.
info: Morning and evening sessions near the main temple.

activities.title: Palkhi Procession
activities.description: Participate in the annual Tukaram Palkhi procession to Pandharpur, a centuries-old devotional tradition.
info: Covers about 250 km from Dehu to Pandharpur.

attractions.title: Sant Tukaram Temple
attractions.description: A grand temple built in memory of Sant Tukaram Maharaj, featuring intricate carvings and a spiritual aura.

attractions.title: Indrayani River Ghat
attractions.description: The sacred ghat where Tukaram Maharaj performed kirtans and spiritual gatherings.

marineLife.intro: While Dehu is not a coastal area, its connection with the Indrayani River represents purity, devotion, and the flow of spiritual energy.

items.title: Spiritual Purity
items.description: The Indrayani River is regarded as sacred, symbolizing the purity of devotion and the Bhakti path.

items.title: Unity in Devotion
items.description: The annual Palkhi Yatra unites people across Maharashtra, transcending caste and class through faith.

conclusion: Dehu’s devotion-filled air and musical bhajans create an immersive spiritual experience.
An essential stop for devotees following the Warkari tradition.

howToReach.title: By Train
details: Nearest railway station: Pune Junction (30 km)
Local trains and buses available to Dehu.

howToReach.title: By Road
details: Frequent MSRTC buses from Pune to Dehu.

howToReach.title: By Air
details: Nearest airport: Pune International Airport (25 km)
Cabs and buses available from the airport.

bookingTips.description: Plan your visit around the Tukaram Palkhi festival for a vibrant spiritual experience.
Carry rain gear during monsoon months.
Book lodges or dharmashalas in Dehu or Pune for comfortable stay.
